title: Maximizing the Chemical Removal of Ceria Abrasives in CMP for Silicon Oxide and Metal Polishing

samples.experiment_context: XPS characterization of as-received Ce1 ceria powder (Sigma-Aldrich) to determine initial Ce3+ concentration.

solvent.name: DI water (for slurry prep before drying for XPS)

samples.experiment_context: XPS characterization of as-received Ce2 ceria powder (Sky Spring Nanomaterials) to determine initial Ce3+ concentration.

solvent.name: DI water (for slurry prep before drying for XPS)

samples.experiment_context: XPS characterization of as-received Ce3 ceria dispersion (Sigma-Aldrich) to determine initial Ce3+ concentration.
XPS study on the effect of pH (2-12) on Ce3+ concentration for Ce1 (68nm) particles.

surface_ce3_percent_xps.conditions: Dried powder, pH 2-12 (negligible change observed, value from Fig 3.10)

samples.experiment_context: XPS study on the effect of pH (2-12) on Ce3+ concentration for Ce2 (20nm) particles.

surface_ce3_percent_xps.conditions: Dried powder, pH 2-12 (negligible change observed, value from Fig 3.10)

samples.experiment_context: XPS study on the effect of pH (2-12) on Ce3+ concentration for Ce3 (5nm) particles.

surface_ce3_percent_xps.conditions: Dried powder, pH 2-12 (negligible change observed, value from Fig 3.10)

samples.experiment_context: XPS study on the effect of H2O2 concentration (0-3 wt%) on Ce3+ concentration for Ce1 (68nm) particles.
XPS study on the effect of H2O2 concentration (0-3 wt%) on Ce3+ concentration for Ce2 (20nm) particles.
XPS study on the effect of H2O2 concentration (0-3 wt%) on Ce3+ concentration for Ce3 (5nm) particles.
XPS study on the effect of surfactants (SDS, PVP, CTAB, Glycine at various concentrations) on Ce3+ concentration for Ce1 (68nm) particles without H2O2.

surface_ce3_percent_xps.conditions: Dried powder, no H2O2, various surfactant concentrations (negligible change observed, value from Fig 3.13a)

samples.experiment_context: XPS study on the effect of surfactants (SDS, PVP, CTAB, Glycine at 0.5 wt%) on Ce3+ concentration for Ce1 (68nm) particles with 0.5 wt% H2O2.

characterization.conditions: Dried powder, 0.5 wt% H2O2, 0.5 wt% surfactant (Values estimated from Fig 3.13b)

samples.experiment_context: Baseline polishing of thermal silicon oxide using a commercial ceria slurry.

Polishing thermal silicon oxide using Ce1 (68nm) slurry at 1.0 wt%, pH 8, with 0.5 wt% H2O2 (optimal Ce3+).

Polishing thermal silicon oxide using Ce1 (68nm) slurry at 1.0 wt%, pH 8, with 2.0 wt% H2O2.
Polishing thermal silicon oxide using Ce1 (68nm) slurry at 1.0 wt%, 0.5 wt% H2O2, adjusted to pH 4.

Polishing thermal silicon oxide using Ce1 (68nm) slurry at 1.0 wt%, 0.5 wt% H2O2, adjusted to pH 10.
Polishing thermal silicon oxide using Ce1 (68nm) slurry at 1.0 wt%, 0.5 wt% H2O2, adjusted to pH 12.
Polishing thermal silicon oxide using Ce2 (20nm) slurry at 1.0 wt%, pH 8, with optimal H2O2 for Ce3+.

concentration.note: Concentration for max Ce3+ used, not specified in Fig 4.5 text

samples.experiment_context: Polishing thermal silicon oxide using Ce3 (5nm) slurry at 1.0 wt%, pH 8, with optimal H2O2 for Ce3+.

concentration.note: Concentration for max Ce3+ used, not specified in Fig 4.5 text

Polishing thermal silicon oxide using a mix of 80nm and 30nm silica particles for comparison.
